channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report E-2024010421
item.description:
Report E-2024010421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-25T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 16, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of gun wash (UN1993) were punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of products to the trailer interior and adjacent boxes of masking paper. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the gun wash fluid-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, the damaged containers were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the impacted masking paper was placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010459
item.description:
Report X-2024010459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: discovered damaged on work area 1137.outer container was wet.upon inspection one bottle had a loose cap leaking out approx 30 oz of content. DescribePack: failure was due to a loose cap resulting in internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: chemical neutralizer and fold absorb were used to address spill.

item.title: Report X-2024010450
item.description:
Report X-2024010450

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: HALETHORPE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found inside of a bulk truck upside down. Once told by managers i proceeded to grab my hazardous materials cart and placed it inside the cart. DescribePack: leakage due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately taken down to the damage hazmat cage out of reach of the package handlers
